North Korean delegation to visit Moscow, Russian lawmaker saysA North Korean delegation will visit the lower house of Russia's parliament on Feb 13, state news agency RIA quoted a deputy from the opposition Communist Party as saying on Thursday. Thu, 01 Feb 2024 08:07:07 GMT BO7EWKFMINKVZDN7B6SZ76E7FE https://www.reuters.com/world/north-korean-delegation-visit-moscow- Russian-lawmaker-says-2024-02-01/Reuters世界
The fisherman from Senegal keeping Spain's vessels afloatWatching news of Senegalese migrants arriving on the Canary Islands stirs memories for Babou Diouf of the same perilous journey he undertook 17 years ago and his arduous path to his new home - Burela, on Spain's northern coast. Thu, 01 Feb 2024 08:04:54 GMT KV46BHDWKVJHBJ2KZQSAGAJXUU https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/fisherman-senegal-keeping-spains-vessels-afloat-2024-02-01/Nacho Doce, Charlie Devereux世界欧洲
Greek same-sex wedding bill allows couples to dream, at lastWhen Yolanda Kalantzi and Georgia Ampatzidou fell in love eight years ago, they said the idea of getting married was "science fiction" in deeply conservative Greece, where LGBT+ couples cannot wed or adopt. Thu, 01 Feb 2024 08:01:47 GMT 45SXHEB2WVJLZMIBXPZ7SZROLA https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/greek-same-sex-wedding-bill-allows- Couples-dream-last-2024-02-01/Renee Maltezou世界欧洲
Belgium's PM De Croo 'confident' agreement on aid to Ukraine can be reacheadBelgium's Prime Minister Alexander De Croo said on Thursday he was confident the leaders of the 27 European Union member states would find an agreement on financial aid to Ukraine. Indonesia leader accused of bias, interference in presidential electionIndonesian President Joko Widodo is facing mounting public criticism over his perceived political interference and lack of neutrality as he campaigns for the leading candidate in this month's presidential election. Thu, 01 Feb 2024 07:33:44 GMT RZMHUQKE4FMGBII4TIYFEHMQ2E https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/indonesia-leader-accused-bias-interference-presidential-election-2024-02-01/Kate Lamb, Stanley Widianto世界亚太地区
A Ukrainian couple, held as POWs by Russia, are finally reunitedWhen Illia Muzyka, a 29-year-old border guard in the southern Ukrainian city of Mariupol, was captured soon after Russia's full-scale invasion, he feared never seeing his fiancee again. New blow for Thai election winners as lawyer launches dissolution bidAn activist lawyer lodged a petition on Thursday seeking to dissolve Thailand's Move Forward Party over its plan to amend a law protecting the monarchy from criticism, in a setback for a party that won an election on a bold agenda of liberal reform. Europe's angry farmers fuel backlash against EU ahead of electionsIn the last 12 months, the cost of running Jean-Marie Dirat's lamb farm in southwest France has jumped by 35,000 euros ($38,000), driven up by increasingly expensive fertilisers, fuel, electricity and pesticides. Philippines plans to buy submarines to defend sovereignty in South China Sea - senior officialPhilippines President Ferdinand Marcos Jr has approved the third phase of the military's modernisation, which includes the purchase of the country's first submarine, in order to defend its maritime sovereignty in the disputed South China Sea. Pakistan election panel summons meeting on rising poll violencePakistan's election panel has summoned top security officials for a meeting on Thursday to discuss increasing violence in the country's western provinces ahead of next week's national election, including the killing of a candidate a day earlier. Thu, 01 Feb 2024 06:10:42 GMT OP6EPXHUNFJZROLREEGSAHHXOE https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/pakistan-election-panel-summons-meeting-rising-poll-violence-2024-02-01/Gibran Peshimam世界亚太地区
Fatigue sets in for Japan earthquake survivors facing long road to recoveryMoments after a magnitude 7.6 earthquake struck western Japan on New Year's Day, Yoshimi Tomita was trapped in the dark under the roof of her collapsed house, feeling the sharp edges of protruding nails.
